Reviews.Title: “If you stay here do not pre book and give them your credit card details”
Reviews.Author: Craig V
Reviews.Content: Firstly some internet searches and publications list this as a gay hotel. It is NOT a gay hotel. The only resources there for gay travellers were a couple of out of date maps. There are 2 sides to this hotel. We pre booked on the internet and gave a credit card for a deposit. Once we did that we were trapped by their cancellation policy. We stayed 5 nights and were given a room downstairs at the back of the main hotel. The room was large, it was summer, the was a small fan that sounded like a plane taking off. The only ventilation was from a window without screen that opened onto a roof littered with cigarette butts, stagnant water in drain pipes and a couple of used condoms. With the window open we got devoured by mosquitoes and the walls and ceiling were smeared with the blood and remains of mosquitoes squahed by previous guests. No attempt was made to clean them. We asked for another room but were told there was none. I said I had noticed a better room at the front was vacant and was told that room was for 3 people not 2 and a lot more expensive. The next day I heard the receptionist rent the room to a single woman who walked in off the street and the rate was about 2/3 of what we were paying for a vastly inferior room. We also heard another man who had booked in advance and was tied into their cancellation policy leave his room and move to another hotel because it was so bad. The receptionist spoke to the "boss" over the phone and the boss said that the man would be charged for his full stay even though he was not going to be there and later that day I heard the receptionist let the room at a greatly reduced rate to someone who phoned up and then arrived from the station without booking ahead. There are some ok rooms at this hotel but they seem to be reserved for walk ins and people who book on the day. Those who book in advance are given inferior rooms at inflated rates because they are captives to the cancellation policy whllst those who are not tied into the cancellation policy are treated very differently with better rooms at cheaper rates. Also when we were there, there was a street festival on. The street were packed with drunk people and the owner opened the toilets in the hotel to the public, charging people 2 euros each to use them. This meant queues of drunk loud people in the corridors and that the guests sharing these facilities had to wait in a line. In addition despite heavy volume of use there was no extra cleaning of the toilets.

Reviews.Title: “Rustic, comfortable and friendly”
Reviews.Author: Xristo P
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed an attic room overlooking the canal, the room was clean and just enough room for a single. It was mid february when the canals were frozen over, with a slight draft from the opening window, however adequate heating made the room comfy. Staff were helpful and friendly, WiFi was free in the room and in the reception dining area. I spent three nights here and would definitely return. One staff member told me a story late one evening about this building having secret partitions where people had been hidden during the Nazi Occupation. He couldn't show me them but it was a good story. Being more of a beer person, the staff told me of places nearby to enjoy the broad range of Dutch beers. There are two very good french restaurants nearby and good breakfast coffee cafes. If you are looking for a good steak and beer restaurant cafe, try Cafe Loetje, also good for fish menu and deserts.

Reviews.Title: “Started off so bad then it was brilliant!”
Reviews.Author: scotsdevil
Reviews.Content: This hotel really has 2 sides to it, if the staff ask you to follow them across the road to the "other rooms" run for the hills!! We arrived just after midnight on the 9th February and was informed that our room was just around the corner. We left the main part of the hotel and went to the left then across the path where the roadworks were taking place. It was then we were lead into what can only be described as the room from hell, it was disgusting with the walls marked, poorly decorated, mold on the ceiling, cupboard literally falling apart, broken tills on the floor of the bathroom . . . the list goes on. It would have been fitting had you paid 20 euros a night, we of course had not and when I discovered the human hair and stained quilt cover that was the final straw, this unfortunately was in the morning after one of the worst nights sleeps in my life!! We immediately went to reception and not only complained but took the opportunity to show the receptionist the photos which would be uploaded onto Tripadvisor on our return. The receptionist was absolutely brilliant, could not apologise enough and explained we will be moved once the room in the main hotel was available (around 12 that day). Thankfully the one which was marked for us (double room) was not available and we got the twin which was perfectly located at the front of the building and included a view of the canal. The room was clean, carpeted, big bathroom, comfortable and clean bed and black out curtains, stark comparison to the other room. The hotel is around a 20 minute walk into Damn Square and even shorter to the first group of pubs, resturants and cafe's. As it was -10 degrees celsius we did not ventur out too far, however, we did make the history museum which was very informative and the sex museum which was utter rubbish! If you are going for the "smoking" cafes there are no shortage with one on almost ever street, the journey from the airport via train is about 10 mins and the central station is about a half hour walk from the hotel. Absolutely stunning city with great friendly people

Reviews.Title: “It's okay.”
Reviews.Author: SammyUgg
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in the central part of Amsterdam (Zentrum) in the Prinsengracht canal. Anna Frank House is 20 minutes away by foot, and the Amsterdam Centraal (Main Train Station) about the same. The staff was friendly and the room was okay. It was clean and pretty comfortable. Some people complain about the stairs, but they didn't bother me -- they are steep for usual standards, but nothing to complain about. Basically, if you just need a crash for the night, go ahead and book this hotel. If you're looking for something luxurious, look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Waste of money”
Reviews.Author: mrbully
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights very bad hotel. The staff were very friendly the room was big. The bed squeeked pillows awful. toilet u could barely fit in. The worse part me and my partner got bitten by bugs all over absolute horrible flee pit room we never get bitten at home. 2nd night building work above us from 7am woke us up banging loud wen I went to reception at 9.30 to complain they did offer me a change of room bit late then. Hotel is not worth the money they charge. Be careful before booking I looked at reviews but i ignored them. We paid Â£85 pounds per nite if u ask me that's a complete rip off for this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not good in a nice neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: Sven D
Reviews.Content: Very small room, fit for a double bed but not for two people at the same time in the room. Most of the things in the room is in some way broken or chipped. If you sit on the toilet you can not close the door - your legs is in the way. The shower is suprisingly good. Nice neighbourhood.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate for a city break but look out!”
Reviews.Author: JessHolland
Reviews.Content: I don't like writing bad reviews and I don't wont to make this one but there are certain things I want others to know about this hotel if they're thinking of booking it, not to put anybody off but just to know what to expect when they arrive. Ok so I'll start with the good stuff! Me and my partner arrived here about 12 in the afternoon and as check in wasn't until 2 thought we'd go say we're here, drop our luggage off and have a wander round however our room was ready when we got there so we popped straight up to dump our stuff. I've read people complain about the stairs in Amsterdam hotels before but I think they're lovely and quaint. The bed was quite comfy and warm too, I mean who doesn't like a comfy bed! The location was brilliant, it was a 10 minute walk from Rembrandt square which is choc-a-block full of bars, shops, coffeeshops and the like, a very nice place to wind the day away in. When we go in to our room I noticed our window was open so I tried to close it but it wouldn't no matter how much a pushed here and there and neither could my boyfriend so when we went back down we asked if it could be closed and the woman at reception said it would be later on that day (which it wasn't, nor was it throughout our 3 days there). The toilet door didn't shut properly, there was a good 2 inch gap so if you are in the room we were I hope that you're a very close couple of very good friends. Our towels were changed every day which was good but our sheets weren't changed once. Now for the worst part. I am very suseptable to insect bites, gnats that sort of thing when I go away...to warm tropic places. However every morning when I woke up I'd find another 2/3 bites on my body somewhere, really painful and itchy, very unsightly to say the least. My boyfriend also got some and he never gets bitten. I don't want to say the b word but I think there might have been bed bugs in our room, the weather there was almost identical to it is back in my home town in England and I haven't had any bites here. I think this is the thing that got to me most. I can put up with a dodgy toilet door, dodgy shower anything, just not bed bugs. Apart from that I'd recommend the hotel as it was a very good price considering the location, I would have defiantly stayed here again if it was just going to be me and my partner in the room with no little visitiors but now I wouldn't.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Radioorange
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I've stayed at the ITC in Amsterdam. First time was over 23 years ago. I had the top floor attic room facing the canal. The room was basic and very small but pleasant enough if you didn't want to spend much time in your room. The shared bathroom / toilets were clean with plenty of hot water. My TV wasn't tuned in but I wasn't bothered about that. Watch the vending machine on the first floor as it doesn't give change, or my drink on one occasion (hotel staff kindly sorted that out). The location was amazing and near to the major sites. I walked everywhere not needing public transport once! The hotel staff were friendly and helpful (especially Justyna and Michael on the front desks, who went out of their way to answer questions). This was the cheapest hotel I could find for my budget. However I've been told Amsterdam is now really expensive . Which is a pity as I would love to return again one day but Â£70 per night in any hotel seems too much!!!! I enjoyed my stay and yes I would return to ITC (depending on lottery winnings ) . It's basic 2** affair but if you only use the hotel as a base to sleep its fine. Enjoy the steep staircase!

Reviews.Title: “I will never stay there again”
Reviews.Author: regina_seliverstova
Reviews.Content: Location: good Staff:good Rooms: tiny, like a cell; no shower and a toilet in the room Price: too high for such hotel

Reviews.Title: “A bit strange”
Reviews.Author: uelij
Reviews.Content: The guy at the reception was a bit confused, didnt know which room he wanted to give me and mostly starred in his monitor without saying anything. When he finally found out, we had to change the building, walk past the abandoned reception of a former hotel (?) and there we were. Lets say, the beds were ok, it was quiet, the warm water was really hot, for the rest check the pics!

Reviews.Title: “Could be better...”
Reviews.Author: Sayantan_Ghati
Reviews.Content: Well located...you have the view of the canal from some rooms. Steep stairs are also okay. Heating is not very good, if you are travelling in winter. Little uncomfortable but okay.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for the money.”
Reviews.Author: Liketogo56
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very basic, but an excellent value for Amsterdam for those who are looking for a clean affordable place to stay . Our room was very small, without much of a view, but it was squeeky clean and the bed was comfortable. The hotel is in a charming location in the southern canal ring and there are many cozy pubs and good restaurants nearby, and also it is near the tramline. The staff was friendly and helpful at all times. I would recommend it for those who have somewhat limited funds and would rather spend them enjoying the city than on a posh hotel room. It would not suit all,especially if you cannot climb stairs, but was just what we expected and needed.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL AND FRIENDLY STAFF AND MANAGEMENT”
Reviews.Author: tiagobalsini
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay in a great place with lovely staff, clean room and a lot of privacity its is the place to stay in Amsterdam. And off course the prices are very very good for one 2 star hotel. Is near of all coffee shops and tourist atractions and you can see the channel in your front. I will recommend this hotel to all my friends who comes to Amsterdam for a short or long stays. If you want deep informations about the cultural life ask for Justyna, she is in charge of the hotel in the week days, she give you all support for a perfect stay in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “One of those budget hotels you better avoid”
Reviews.Author: Cosmos_Estrela
Reviews.Content: It seems there are 2 types of budget hotels. On the one hand you have those budget hotels where offering inexpensive rooms with a minimal service level is a conscious decision, like easyHotel, and these hotels typically offer simple but clean and decent looking rooms with decent furniture. Then on the other hand you have those budget hotels that over the years have become so worn and run down that they cannot pretend they are any but a budget hotel. And ITC Hotel definitely belongs to this second category. The hotel is centrally located and that is perhaps its only good feature. Overall the hotel gives a rather run down feeling, with the stairs/hallway in need of a paint job and the smell of smoke/marijuana permeating the building, the hallways and the rooms as it definitely does not look like this hotel has a non-smoking policy. My room was a decent size for Amsterdam standards, but that probably was mainly because I had opted to go for a double room instead of a single room, which I feared would be too small. The room was rather noisy, with sounds coming both from the hallway and the upstairs room, the bed sheets smelled strongly of smoke, things like the remote control and the lamp above the sink weren't working and I couldn't say the room was overly clean. All in all it is one of those hotels you stay once and never come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Gross, Dont Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: Angear77
Reviews.Content: The one and only good thing I can say about this hotel is its just a few blocks walking distance from Rembrant Square, but thats it. The room was tiny and smelled, heater did not work. The bathroom door did not reach all the way to the floor, therefore there was no privacy. The shower curtain so moldy it stuck to its self in one big clump, nasty nasty, nasty. And for $116 US, outrageous.

Reviews.Title: “Small but with a good location and a nice price!”
Reviews.Author: snuddie
Reviews.Content: The room was very small, but we got a room with a lovely view over the canal. Very clean! Nice neigbourhood. The location is good, walking-distance to everything. If you don't want to walk there is a tramstation just across the street. No elevetor. Perfect for me and my partner who didn't spend to much time in the hotel. Cheap!

Reviews.Title: “No frills but in a good location”
Reviews.Author: the_thrifty_bee
Reviews.Content: This hotel is near some of the main attractions of Amsterdam, such as the Amstel river, Leidseseplein and Rembrandtsplein, the Museumplein and about 1/2 hr walk from Anne Franks House. It is also within walking distance of Centraal station, but can be reached by many different tram and bus services. The Stop/Go from the station is just 1 EURO. The hotel we stayed in was not ITC but the Townhouse, which is just over the other side of the Prinsengracht. We had booked a double room, but were given a twin room which we were not totally happy with as it was also very small, but there was a shower and hairdryer which we had not expected. We were given fresh towels, soap and bed linen each day, and the hotel was quite clean. However, there was a thick glue-like substance on the windowsills which was not removed and the table had a number of stains on it and looked as though it had not been cleaned for some time! Also, there was no wardrobe nor coathangers and no kettle, despite the fact that we had been provided with coffee, tea and cups! I was also extremely disconcerted about the lack of staff. Despite the very friendly receptionist we did not meet any other staff members during our entire stay! I believe that the Townhouse is actually unstaffed as on the Wednesday morning we were woken at 8am by a smoke alarm, followed by a door alarm. This was because a group of individuals on our floor had been smoking cannabis in the shared toilet facility and had run away from the hotel once the alarms went off. We had to wait outside for some time until the hotelier from over the way at ITC came to switch off the alarm. In fact, he said that this must not happen again as the alarm wires had to be cut! Goodness knows what should happen if there is a real fire in the hotel. Also, the hotel has a strict no-smoking policy according to a number of sources yet the smell of cigarette and cannabis smoke was almost constantly present. Despite these negatives, however, the hotel is in a good spot and provides the value for money that is to be expected from a 2 star hotel. With a bit more attention to the decor, upkeep and cleanliness of the hotel the Townhouse could get better reviews. This sort of hotel is for the no-frills, budget traveller, and backpackers/younger travellers looking for something that not far off from being a youth hostel.

Reviews.Title: “Budget accomodation in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: Stuart_2805
Reviews.Content: In my opinion the best location in the city. Easy walking distance of the Museums, Opera House and Concertgebouw. Easy transprot connections to Red Light District and Leidesplein or a 20 minute or so walk from either. The Cafes and eating places in Utrechtstraat and Rembrandtplein are on the doorstep. My single room was small but clean and comfortable and fair value for the price. The rooms are small and the walls thin but no more so than in similar hotels everywhere. A feature of Amsterdams architecture is tall narrow buildings with corresponding staircases which make humping heavy luggage a pain. Travel light if possible.

Reviews.Title: “Tolerable budget option”
Reviews.Author: RoamingTheGlobe
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights. All inclusive, this budget option was 42 euros/night, which for Amsterdam is cheap, but this was very expensive for a single room in the attic. I booked on hotels.nl and it was the cheapest option that didn't have horrifying reviews. I was on the top floor, where the single rooms with shared bathroom are located. I was surprised at how much they were able to cram into a tiny room: a closet big enough for my 2 backpacks, a sink, a desk, 2 chairs, a nightstand and a single bed with an extremely large mattress. If you went out the window, you were on the roof! I appreciated having the basin in the room, and the bathrooms were kept clean. Walls are thin, and one night I heard every word of the neighbor's conversation with whomever was on the other end of his telephone. The free wifi worked surprisingly fine up there. It wasn't so fun hauling my bags up 4+ flights of steep stairs, but I managed. The last staircase into the attic was VERY steep and at 5'8", I had to duck to avoid the low ceiling. When I checked out, I had my 65 liter pack on my back and actually got stuck when my pack got wedged between a stair and the ceiling! I thought this was hilarious, but I know that others would probably not; it was quite dangerous. The lady at the front desk was always very friendly. The housekeeper was not so. Checkout time was 12:00 and I had left in the morning of my checkout day to get some breakfast and run some last-minute errands. My flight wasn't until mid-afternoon, so I wanted to occupy the room until checkout time. I came back at 11:30 and the door to the shared bathroom was locked and my room had been cleaned - with my bags still in the rooms. The housekeeper looked visibly irritated that it was approaching noon and I was still there, though I had every right to be. She appeared to have finished cleaning the rooms on that level and had unlocked the bathroom door, so I was able to go in finally. I went back to the room and washed my hands and brushed my teeth in the clean sink, wasting a new bar of soap, and feeling unnecessarily guilty and more than a little bit annoyed. The front desk gave me a roll of breath mints when I checked out as a gift. An important note about this hotel is that they do not have a no-drug policy like some of the other hotels in the city. When I walked into the front door of this hotel (which BTW, was often left standing open for anyone to enter freely) I was greeted by a visible cloud of marijuana smoke. It was like entering a nightclub. I am not a smoker, and any more than 3 days here would have been too much. I would only stay here again if it were by far the cheapest option in high season.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible accommodation - lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: Japanista
Reviews.Content: We were forced to stay at the ITC after being caught up in the current Volcano chaos at Schipol Airport. We were in transit from Kuwait with no luggage and found ourselves stuck in Amsterdam for 4 nights. On our second night when rooms were very thin on the ground we managed to find a room at the ITC. The write up at the airport stated a clean, safe hotel in a 'traditional canal house style' in central Amsterdam. We were quoted 150 Euros ... but in desperation we agreed. There is no doubt the hotel is in a lovely location. Walkable to Rembrandt Square and lovely quaint streets filled with interesting places to dine and drink. The hotel itself however is pretty below par ... BASIC is the word. We were given room 15 which is little more than a basement with 2 very old beds, dirty matresses and a wardrobe that is falling to bits. The window opens out onto a concrete wall and a drain ... the smell was appalling with other guests obviously smoking Marijuana in their rooms. The bathroom was little more than a second thought and absolutely stank of mould. There was no soap, towels or toilet paper on arrival - although this was sorted out as soon as I went up to reception. This brings me on to the staff - they really are lovely ... could not do enough to help and almost compensated for the dirty accomodation. Christine on reception was happy to get us toothbrushes and toothpaste (all our luggage was .. and is still at the airport!) and gave us unlimited access to the internet and let us use the phone on reception to try and order a ferry - she is an asset to the hotel (and could really get a position in a much better establishment!!). She gave us excellent directions to our next hotel in the morning and apologized for our filthy room. So all in all this place is a tale of 2 halves, lovely staff and great location ... if you don't mind sleeping in a dirty bed in a room that smells of mold ... your choice :)

Reviews.Title: “Adequate.”
Reviews.Author: fliernurse
Reviews.Content: Not great, not terrible, but adequate for my stay. I booked online. I took the tram from the Park & Ride, then walked the one block plus distance to the hotel. Reception was pleasant, cooperative, and friendly. I asked for a certain room and she was very accomodating. The room was tiny by American standards, but this is Amsterdam. Room key is credit card type which is reassuring to me. Gets you in the room and the hotel. Hotel is an old house, reminded me of old San Francisco homes. Decor reminded me of cheap third world hotels but without the sleaze and everything worked. Heat adequate, hot water hot, window in the shower was nice. I had no need for a room with a view but it was nice to air out the room. Breakfast was a sad affair and if that's important to you it could be a deal breaker. Unimportant for me. Cleanliness was acceptable. Bed was made on the second day even though I didn't care if it was. I just couldn't find a "Do not Disturb" sign in the room. Room could have been quieter. On the second day I asked if I could extend and she gave me a Saturday price of about 150 Euros. I declined. I would stay again if the price was reasonable. I left when the volcanic ash was grounded flights and the hotel was booked full. The hotel's strong point is their staff, nice and pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: eeculp
Reviews.Content: We found the ITC hotel to be a perfect fit. We were lucky enough to have a room on the first floor of the main building; there is another building. Fresh towels and soaps every day, in-room tv and reading lights. The bathroom was small and separated from the main room by only a swinging door, but this wasn't a problem. Everything was clean. We could leave our luggage at the desk and use the free wifi even before official check-in time. Wifi reached our room, too. Free coffee and tea service. Extremely comfortable bed. Courteous and helpful reception. No window view. Breakfast is 7.50 euro and can be found cheaper in a few nearby cafes. Ring the doorbell upon arrival. Many free maps and coupons to attractions. Scenic, quiet location in southern canal belt. Never required public transport except from to and from Amstel Station and the airport.

Reviews.Title: “pleasant, nice location and nice service”
Reviews.Author: safeadonna
Reviews.Content: the service provided by the front desk was immaculate, great help for all my questions. stayed in a 1 bedroom shared bathroom. roomservice came everyday around noon, and cleaned the shared bathroom daily. (maybe twice also) one of the cheapest hotels in amsterdam, but great value for money. although i would rather eat somewhere else than their breakfast, but thats just because i'm not a toast and juice loving guy, plus there is a great bakery right outside the entrance door.

Reviews.Title: “Quite a surprise....:--(”
Reviews.Author: STEVE-CH-I
Reviews.Content: I spent 2 nights at this hotel which I booked online via the hotel website ( room # 3 ). To start with this place is a Canal House not a modern hotel. Which is, yes the stairs are really steep and there's no elevator ( no comfortable if you have heavy or a lot of baggage ) and what travellers might expect from a hotel are not going to get at this place. Even if posted on the hotel website, there's no bar but wending machine, breakfast is served by the receptionist on the 2 tables that are available for ( with a very nice view indeed ), no toiletries in the room, no safe & no internet. When I visited ( Nov. 24,2009 ) there were works on the rail line of tram nr. 4 which included a diversion to a different stop. Keep in mind you will need between 10 and 20 minutes by foot depending on where you get off to reach the hotel. Don't rely too much on the door bell when checking is, as it is not always attended ( in my case, I was waiting for a good 6 mins before a guest came out of the building to let me in ). After you are checked in you will receive your own key though. Rooms are very basically appointed and furniture shows the ages. In my room 2 main light bulb were not working or missing and no one ever replace them. Some linen were stained. The room overlooked the opposite building, 20 meters aways, so you could see inside the other places but no view of the canal and not even the sky. There's no really a bathroom but a separate shower & toilet were closed off by a door, which didn't close propely, while a sink was next to the bed. There was a folded away table attached to the wall. Walls are also not that soundproofed. The reception was always attended but I only found one lady very helpfull with informations and directions. The location of this place is very interesting and at the time of booking for a double room single occupancy I paid 59 â‚¬uros without breakfast, though the room wasn't really double and if you pay the bill with your C/C you will get a 3% surcharge. The hotel rate wasn't expensive for Amsterdam standards but there are a bit too many downs to let me choose this property again.

Reviews.Title: “Totally satisfied -- would stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: tomgoody
Reviews.Content: I stayed in room number 11, on the third floor of the ITC for about $35 euro per night. The room looked newly remodeled and overlooked a canal. The wifi is good. Staff was very accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice staff, but not that nice of a hotel!”
Reviews.Author: DNizzle
Reviews.Content: The hotel's location is good; fairly close to the attractions and on a nice, fairly quiet, canal street. The front desk was actually pretty nice; especially the late night guy who let me make a couple of international calls using the front desk phone when I couldn't make them from the pay phone. The 4th floor shared bathroom was clean and well stocked with toilet paper. Now for the bad comments: To get up to the 4th floor (the attic floor,) I had to climb a stairwell that was more like a ladder than stairs. Also, the room was kind of shady. The window frame was broken so the window was hard to get up and down, the mirror was cracked, the paint was chipping, and the TV got terrible reception. Also, the room seemed to make me a little 'ithcy.' AND there was a strange off & on rumbling noise from the room next door that sounded like someone was chopping off body parts. If you're traveling on your own, and on a tight budget, I say go ahead. If traveling with a partner, and can pay a few extra $$$, I say go somewhere a lil nicer!!!

Reviews.Title: “An absolute rip off”
Reviews.Author: PollBrighton
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two nights and were charged 400 Euros for two nights' substandard accommodation - unfortunately we had booked two rooms, which meant a total of 800. The price was apparently inflated because of a banking conference in the city that weekend. Problems with our room included a window propped open by two plastic water bottles because of a broken sash; a faulty door handle - a clear fire hazard; a miniscule and unventilated toilet area; a bed more like three-quarter sized than double - a proper double bed would not have fitted into the narrow, inexpertly-divided room; damp in the wardrobe; a partly-unpainted ceiling; a cigarette burn in the duvet cover; only half a roll of toilet paper on arrival; a stained and burned bedside cabinet; no hairdryer; no shampoo/ shower gel/ tissues; no tea/ coffee making facilities in the room; no breakfast included in the price; apparently no bar, as advertised and pictured on the website ....I could go on. The receptionist offered me a 15% discount, but the owner instructed him to withdraw this offer. The owner refused to speak to me and has failed to anser any of my emails. Two other guests complained that they had been charged considerably more for an equally substandard room. Another had had no hot water over the weekend. We were unable to move hotels, as we were advised that we would still be charged for our second night. Really really horrible and an absolute rip off. I wouldn't recommend this place to my worst enemy.

Reviews.Title: “never again”
Reviews.Author: Bernal78
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this terrible hotel two nights. The misleading photos published on the booking sites.They do not match up with the real rooms.The rooms are not clean enough. No soap, toilet paper and raggy towels with holes.The furnitures and beds are poor, old-fashioned and some of them are even broken. The hotel is too expensive compared to the quality of the rooms.Not only the pictures, the value of the hotel also does not match up with the price. The manager/owner has no idea about the hotel management, even the staff manage the hotel better than him. A manager /owner without qualifications made this wonderful situated hotel poor and poor.. The only positive thing about this hotel is the location. it is located in a beautiful part of the city and close to downtown.

Reviews.Title: “100% mismatch between price asked and quality offered”
Reviews.Author: BoAOslo
Reviews.Content: If you want okay quality, check reviews like these beforehand to not repeat our mistake. I have seen reviews stating that this hotel is okay. To optimistic people I would say: Read the statistics from many customer reviews with approx. 70% judging the hotel as terrible is astonishing - or perhaps frightening. When we checked out, 4 out of 5 people were complaining (80%), so the ITC Hotel seems to be very consistent in its approach to 'very high pay for extremely low quality'. This hotel is just unbelievably expensive compared to everything offered. The only real value item is the nice location next to the canal, but that does not compensate for super-small, poorly cleaned rooms without simple items as toilet paper and shampoo. This should serve as an indicator of hotel management desire for short-term profit. Even the staff at check-out admitted that the hotel is poor quality compared to the price. I never heard that from any hotel staff before!!! I travel a lot and this is a clear #1 in mismatch between price asked and quality offered, so if ITC Hotel Amsterdam wants to become champions in any area, my suggestion would be 'ripping customers off without offering much back'.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hospitality.”
Reviews.Author: HenriCanada
Reviews.Content: Excellent hospitality and a great location. Stayed there for many many times. Thank you very much. See you next time.

Reviews.Title: “dont be scared by the other reviews,its a ok hotel”
Reviews.Author: travellingchick05
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend really wanted to get away on a little romantic holiday, we didnt have a lot of time planning so i just booked a hotel that seemed ok for our budget. i stumbled upon the ITC and just booked it without reading any reviews. After that i took a better look and was horrified by the really bad reviews this hotel had gotten, "dont stay at this hotel" and stories of creepy crawles in bed with you really freaked me out. So,i feared the worst, and just hope for the best! I must say this hotel really surprised me- YES the rooms are tiny,but they are clean and there was nothing scary about it anymore. i must recommend anyone staying at the ITC that you call in advance and ask that you stay in the main building because i think they have a tendancy to fill up the other building across the street before placing anyone in the ''real''hotel the main building. They are like two different worlds i must say. We were placed in the additional building for the first night but switched over to the main building fot the remainder of our trip! Very good location just a small walk to absolutley everything- shopping streets,train station,bars,coffee shops!!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all costs”
Reviews.Author: kitty_wonka
Reviews.Content: This was an absolute nightmare of a stay. The staff was mostly rude (with the exception of one staff member who was apologetic and kind). Most of the staff were sarcastic and unhelpful (suggesting that the problem with a room that was filthy and smelt of an ashtray) was the 'view'. We ended up moving after 2 nights since the hotel management was completely unapologetic and extremely rude when we tried to voice our concerns. One member of our team arrived early and was put into a filthy room only to be moved the next day. However, that evening, another member of our party was put into the original room that was deemed unacceptable. Whatever you do, avoid this place like the plague.

Reviews.Title: “It was fine...”
Reviews.Author: carabali
Reviews.Content: I just stayed there for a couple of nights. The room was tiny, I could touch both sides of the wall with outstretched arms. But it was clean and had a private shower and toilet, and also a small window. It's in a great location, you can walk everywhere from there. I think it was fine for a few nights. Especially if your single and know that you aren't going to spend much time in the room anyway. I would stay again, especially for the price and location. It only cost me $97. euros for two nights.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go to this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: hoshipan
Reviews.Content: Me and my sister had a problem in Amsterdam and at 2 a.m. we didn't know where to stay. All the hotel were full and the only room we found was at the ITC hotel. It was a terrible experience. The receptionist was really bad-mannered. He didn't show us our room until we didn't give him the money. Then he said that the room was in another building. We crossed the street to go there and when we saw the room we didn't want to pass the night there. There was no reception in the other building, it was dirty, small windows. We felt that sleeping in the street was safer than sleeping there. We came back to the receptionist and asked our money back(150 euros, 2 people, 1 night!)and he didn't want to give us the money. Than he gave us only 50%. He got angry and started shouting. We were scared, we take the 50% and went away. Please, don't go there!!

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: jimphelan3
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with 2 others. The room was small, grubby, and expensive. I was double-charged and it took me 4 months to get my money back off them, during which time they denied owing me any money, and tried every trick in the book to avoid refunding me. Do not stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Dont go to this hotel”
Reviews.Author: EUHR
Reviews.Content: Frendly Advise: Do not book this hotel for staying in Amsterdam! Its not worth anything

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Pay To Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: reggie24
Reviews.Content: From arrival- we spent a day trying to find alternative accomodation- to our despair without success - and so tried to get flights home- it is that bad. The hotel is dirty, our room had doors and handles hanging off all of the sparse filthy furniture. The curtains did not cover the window or protect us from the burly workforce peering through filthy windows. There was no door as such on the bathroom. The bathroom was a tiled cupbouard that also enclosed the toilet and a washbasin- situated behind the shower- so you had to walk through collected water to use the loo!! The pillows on the campbeds- for which the matresses were too long- may as well have been made of balled up socks. It is a tradgedy, as the location was exceptional. This is a really hip part of town with all you could need for lazybreakfasts, organic lunches, pubs, shopping, nightcaps- all within 5/10 minutes walk- i would suggest findng the nearest hotel to the ITC

Reviews.Title: “amsterdam september 2008”
Reviews.Author: zanyEngland
Reviews.Content: stayed for three nights with friends.Â  Wonderful location, but that is really all I can say that is positive.Â  Vastly overpriced.Â Â  Rooms needed a good clean and new curtains and furniture.Â Â  washing/shower and toilet facilities inadequate. Breakfast not worth the extra money.Â Â  Go round the corner to the wonderful coffee houses.Â  The web site for the hotel is NOT up to date.Â  There is no bar, and most of the guests sensibly did not come and sample the delights of the breakfast provided.Â

Reviews.Title: “Never again...”
Reviews.Author: SazzyCat
Reviews.Content: ITC budget hotel in Amsterdam. I thoroughly enjoyed my stay there in the past, so when my wife and I returned to Amsterdam we decided to stay at ITC. When we arrived, I was disappointed at the changes. While it claims to cater to the gay and lesbian travelers, it is owned and operated by a Chinese family. We made our reservations 6 months ahead of time. We were coming in on a red eye and would be arriving at mid morning. We emailed the hotel and asked if we could make arrangements to check in early. We were told there would be no problem; however upon our arrival we were not allowed to check in early. When we showed the desk clerk/manager the email granting us permission to check in that morning, he laughed and said, â€œOh she doesnâ€™t work here anymore. Too bad.â€� When we finally checked in we were put in the smallest room in the back. The only window was in the shower which opened out on a construction site. To say the least we were very disappointed, as we made reservations well in advanced and even mentioned we were repeat guests. We did complain and we were given a much larger room at the same price, but both roomsâ€™ beds were almost unusable they were so broken down and uncomfortable. Plus, we had to request for clean sheets for the bed, as the ones on the bed were obviously dirty. There web site (which is from previous owners of hotel) is now extremely misleading. There is NO bar. The internet access available to guest is dial up. The breakfast, which is 7euros extra, is not what is advertised at web site. No eggs. No Swedish crackers. No assortment of meats. The breakfast is a choice of 2 cold cereals, some sliced cheese and meat. Coffee and orange juice. The breakfast foods looked stale and left over from days before. They advertise 24 porn; however, it is one channel with the same boring, two men replaying over and over. While the staff is courteous, they donâ€™t have a clue about being in the hospitality business. I am a budget traveler and have stayed in many budget hotels. I know what I can expect. ITC has a fresh coat of paint inside, but I have a feeling itâ€™s going down hill from here. I wish I had not ignored the reviews I read before going. I had such a positive experience in the past, I was sure our stay would be just fine. All I can say is, â€œI wish I had heeded the warnings.â€� So dear traveler, I would strongly suggest you stay somewhere else. There are plenty of terrific hotels and hostels in that city.

Reviews.Title: “ITC Hotel a find”
Reviews.Author: anadj58
Reviews.Content: ITC hotel is a small hotel beside Prinsengracht canal in downtown Amsterdam. It is very conveniently located near a great eating area with cuisine from all over the world, the tram stops right outside and the price is very good for such a central area . Before booking over the internet we read several unfavourable reviews and hesitated ,however we were very pleased we proceeded with our booking. We found the hotel to offer all it advertised on its web site and were more than satisfied, considering the great location and compaable prices on the canals in Amsterdam The room was fine in all respects . Clean, good bedding and PLEANTY of hot water. If you want to stay in a typical Dutch house then expect typical Duth staircase.It is unreasonable for anyone to expect 5 star accommodation at 2 star prices. Be realistic. If you are a traveller make the most of the experience and enjoy. .

Reviews.Title: “Was 'okay'”
Reviews.Author: travel_mad83
Reviews.Content: it was okay here at the ITC - we only stayed for one night. I didn't like the location - it was overlooking one of the main canals but was really far down the canal. There was nothing really wrong with our room - it was facing the canal and had two large windows letting in lots of light. I don't think I would stay again though.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, average hotel”
Reviews.Author: ascoltate
Reviews.Content: I am somewhat surprised to see all the really negative reviews on here. In my opinion, the hotel was average--nothing more, nothing less. The staff was very friendly to me, despite their limited English (most spoke Polish, so if you know Polish, it can help). We had a room in the main building, with very efficient wireless internet (although it took a few hours to set up, since the receptionist didn't know how it worked, so I had to wait for the next shift...). The room was not spacious but it was certainly satisfactory. The location was ideal--near transportation with a very friendly bar just nextdoor and walking distance to Rembrandtsplein and beyond. While I wouldn't necessarily seek out this hotel again, I certainly wouldn't refrain from recommending it to a friend (which is how I found out about the hotel).

Reviews.Title: “Okey if you're desperate”
Reviews.Author: Braz-Traveller
Reviews.Content: Tiny little room and I bumped my head on the TV everytime I stood up in the first day. The city was quite full and hard to find a room so I booked two nites at the ITC. I thought it was very expensive for what it is so if you're really desperate stay here if not then steer clear.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel spoiled our holiday”
Reviews.Author: neyu
Reviews.Content: We booked three nights at the ITC Hotel online after checking their website (nice photos) and the location. Mistake number one was not checking TripAdvisor. On arrival, the side-street location overlooking the canal seemed great. But after checking in we were then led round the corner to a grotty ex-hotel on the main road, up some narrow, steep stairs and ushered into what can best be described as a space vaguely resembling a hotel room. Welcome to room no.23. Everything was there - walls, ceiling, bed, window, shower, toilet, sink, etc, but it looked like it had been put together by the local homeless people after a long night on the booze and weed. Our first night (Saturday night) was the noisiest night we have ever experienced in a hotel, and we hardly slept, if at all. Not a good sign. The following morning we went straight round to reception to ask to be moved to a quieter room, only to be told the hotel was fully booked ("its the weekend ya'see - we're busy"). We were offered a quieter room at the back of the main hotel building for the third night, at which we, relunctantly, agreed. During these high-level negotiations they constantly warned us that this new room was smaller than the one we were currently in. And we stupidly thought that was simply not possible! Oh, how wrong we were.... The second night initially proved quieter (fewer drunks outside at 1 in the morning), although still in the room overlooking the main road, so we got to enjoy trams trundling past every 15 minutes until some time after midnight. That is, until about half past two when the fire alarm went off. Or rather, stayed on for about 5 minutes, which is a long time when a loud sounder is blasting you from deep slumber, scaring my wife half to death (not a good thing for a pregnant woman). Day three and we packed our bag, said goodbye to number 23, and looked forward to breakfast and a new room. We headed off into Amsterdam filled with a sense of hope. Oh, how innocent and naive. On return to the hotel we eventually found room number 19. There are photos and a description of this room already on this site in the review by Braxn. Suffice it say this room suffers from Inverse Tardis Syndrome - its smaller on the inside! Yes, this room _was_ smaller than the one we had come from. And the lack of any visible view from any kind of window was very depressing. Indeed, the "view" from the shower cubicle window is of a ventilation/light shaft. Overall, this hotel is the worst hotel we have ever stayed in. Don't be put off by the "gayest hotel in Amsterdam" line - its a cheap shot just to get web hits. The only recommendation we can offer is to stay AWAY from this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed - will not return”
Reviews.Author: josealadro
Reviews.Content: The hotel's web page did not contain any photo of the rooms, but we saw some at easytobook.com that seemed nice. I made a reservation for 3 nights through the hotel's web and they inmediately charged me 20 euros (my bank instantly notifies me of any charges via SMS). The arrival day, at the reception, they asked us to fill a couple of forms, but we asked them to see the room (room #1) first. IT WAS AWFUL. It was at the basement, had two tiny windows to a back roof, smelled bad and was uncomfortable and unhabitable. We asked for another room and there was no one available. We complained about the assigned room against the ones saw at easytobook.com and told them that we were going to search for a room anywhere else. They told us about the cancellation policy and blah blah blah, but they finally said us that it was ok, that we had to pay nothing. What's my surprise when that day at 6pm I receive a charge notification from my bank with the amount of the entire stay (appart from the 20 euros they charged me upon reservation). Cancellation policy? I did not cancel anything. I just rejected that unhabitable room. I'm not going to pay for a room that I haven't even walked in because of the mentiones reasons. Finally my boyfriend and me stayed very pleasantly at The Goden Bear, only a few minutes away. Jose & Manolo, from Spain

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your money!!”
Reviews.Author: mjk101
Reviews.Content: Don't be mislead by the website. This hotel is awful! It is in desperate need of a good clean and redecoration. My advice would be to stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Warning... do not stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Braxn
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nothing short of disgusting. The foyer (really just a lounge room with a desk) is full of old mismatched worn out furniture. Our room was located at the back of the hotel and as soon as we opened the door we could smell that dank smell of mould and dust. The room itself was small and again full of old furniture and carpet. There was only one small window which was located inside the shower and it took quite a bit of effort to force it open. The shower looked like it was a converted cupboard with slat doors, that couldn't close properly, in place of a shower curtain. I suspect this is partially why the place smelt so bad as the water would invariably run straight onto the carpet. The toilet was seperate (thankfully) but it was small and virtually impossible to escape without bumping your head against the wall at some point. The bed was this rooms crowning glory (not). It was either broken in two or it had a severe sag in the middle which gave us both backache. The last straw was when I woke up in the middle of the night with my face up against the wall breathing in the most digusting smell of mould. Needless to say we checked out after one night and I regret not doing it when we first sited the room. What added insult to injury was that we were led to believe this was a gay owned or at least gay friendly hotel. There is nothing to distinguish this hotel from any other and got the impression it was just a marketing ploy to pull more business. Of all the hotels that I stayed in my recent around the world trip this was the only one that I did not check in Trip Advisor prior to my booking. I have learnt my lesson the hard way.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasing”
Reviews.Author: Davey20
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel was perfect, and along with it's nicely presented rooms and friendly staff made this a very enjoyable stay. We spent 1 week there during mid-February. We found the staff to be very helpful and quick to tend to our needs. Everything we asked of them was attended to in a very timely manner. The stairs in the hotel were quite steep which might present a problem for some people, it was quite difficult to get our luggage up them. The rooms were comfortable, welcoming and fairly tidy. Granted they weren't the most modern rooms we've ever seen, but we were pleased nevertheless. Along with their fair prices, we see no reason why we wouldn't stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Yuck”
Reviews.Author: brit62
Reviews.Content: Please do not be swayed by the way this Hotel is presented on their website. The hotel is seedy, dirty, unkept and has the feel of a rent by the hour motel!! We arrived checked in went to our room and turned right back down to the reception area. The bedroom was damp, the bathroom was filthy and there was no soap. The decor was shabby. When we complained and said we would be checking out... all we got was attitude and told they would be charging us for 2 nights stay!!! We attempted to argue that the room was not what we had been sold on the website but the woman we spoke with would not hear anything we said. She kept saying you knew it was a 2 star hotel... well yes we did and we have stayed at some amazing 2 star hotels in Paris and Barcelenoa ... netheir was dirty and unkept like this place. For gay and lesbian travellers this hotel is not what it says it is. Instead stay somewhere that cares about the quality of the services they provide.

HotelInfo.Name: ITC Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Princegracht 1051, Amsterdam 1017 JE, The Netherlands
